intro: Beilschmiedia kwangsiensis, commonly known as the Guangxi beilschmiedia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to China, specifically the Guangxi region, and is typically found in lowland evergreen forests. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
